title: Incorrect debug information generated for test binary for proc-macro crate
body:
Hello!

When investigating an issue with our code coverage reports at [firecracker](https://github.com/firecracker-microvm/firecracker), we noticed a lot `kcov` warning about the DWARF data contained in some binaries containing invalid mappings (e.g. line -> addr mapping that pointed into the middle of instructions). 

I tried this code:

On [this minimal test crate](https://github.com/roypat/break-kcov), run `cargo test --no-run` and extract the DWARF data using `elfread --debug-dump=decodedline`. When matching the output against `objdump -d`, notice how most of the debug information seems to reference non-existing code, or point to places outside of the `.text` segment. 

Alternatively, run `cargo kcov -- --verify --debug=4` (which internally executes `cargo test --no-run`) to see the errors `kcov` reports (culminating in a segmentation fault)

The debug information is correct if the `-Clink-dead-code` code-gen option is passed via `RUSTFLAGS`, however `RUSTFLAGS` are ignored by cargo for proc-macro crates during cross-compilation, which is how we encountered this error.

I expected to see this happen: the debug information to be correct

### Meta

<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.64.0 (a55dd71d5 2022-09-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a55dd71d5fb0ec5a6a3a9e8c27b2127ba491ce52
commit-date: 2022-09-19
host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
release: 1.64.0
LLVM version: 14.0.6
```

I haphazardly tested some old versions of rustc (1.52, 1.54) and a recent nightly, all exhibiting the same behavior.
